cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina and well offshore the Georgia coast
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating toward the northeast, paralleling the U.S. southeast coast, then turning away from the U.S. East Coast after passing near coastal North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: no formal landfall – closest coastal encounter expected near the Outer Banks, NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A (no watches south of Surf City, NC)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City, NC to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coastline from northeast Florida to North Carolina, greatest effects along North Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy onshore winds with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible Sunday afternoon into early Monday, but sustained TS winds are improbable (≤8% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal water level rises (≤1 ft) and rough surf/rip currents along the Georgia beaches; significant surge (>3 ft) not expected at Savannah.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may brush coastal Georgia with brief squalls; widespread totals expected to remain under 1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents for mariners and small craft operating near the entrance channel.
